title: Node is Unable to be Fully Synced
body:
# ðŸž Bug Report

### Description

Thanks to @djrtwo for bringing this up. 

If all the nodes in a network are started up at the same time a few epochs after genesis, none of the nodes become healthy enough to be 'synced' and for validators attached to those nodes to end up producing blocks. What eventually happens is that the network stalls.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

N.A

## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

Start up all the nodes N epochs after genesis(ex: 12). The network will unable to function as none of the nodes are 'synced'

## ðŸ”¥ Error

```
time="2020-07-19 15:07:58" level=debug msg="Requesting blocks" capacity=576 count=64 peer=16Uiu2HAm7CHidDVoz1hvDSNCrjUAdmTkxVHYRd39BEGv3KrS7Cz6 prefix=initial-sync start=1 step=1
time="2020-07-19 15:07:59" level=debug msg="Requesting blocks" capacity=522 count=32 peer=16Uiu2HAm7CHidDVoz1hvDSNCrjUAdmTkxVHYRd39BEGv3KrS7Cz6 prefix=initial-sync start=449 step=1
```

## ðŸŒ  Your Environment

**Operating System:**

N.A

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

Alpha.15

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

> Start up all the nodes N epochs after genesis

To reproduce, the N can be as low as 1 epoch
